for its huge mall, it has become in more recent years a major center of business in
, and is starting to look like an actual city. Once (if) it gets its Metrorail Silver Line station, it's fair to expect it will become a major city.

For now, it's best to bring a car (and there is a ton of free parking). It is conveniently located right by the intersection of I-495 (the Capital Beltway), I-66, and VA-295, which connects it quickly to Dulles International Airport
is also a reasonable 30-50 minute drive along I-66, while it's going to be over an hour from Baltimore-Washington International Airport

down I-95 to I-495.

By public transport from
, take the Metrorail Orange Line to
, then catch Bus #23. This can take a while, especially if you are not by an Orange Line stop in D.C.
Tysons Corner is small enough to get around on foot, although it is quite auto-friendly.

value: content=Unless you are here on business, it's rare to visit anything other than the huge mall itself. Split in two, Tysons 1 has the wider selection of stores and the movie theater, while Tysons 2 has the more upscale stores. The mall is anchored by... everything—it's huge.

content=Just next to the mall is one a great steakhouse (there is a Ruth's Chris up the street too, which is another chain to be reckoned with). Beyond the steak, the wine list received the Award of Excellence from Wine Spectator three years running.
content=Fresh grill and wine bar offering a seasonally inspired menu and international wine list.
content=Specializes in fresh fish and seafood options, but also happy to serve you a burger and beer.

Surprisingly, especially given the fact that all the area hotels appellate "Tysons Corner" to their names, there are no hotels in the Tysons Corner proper—they are located mostly in
Great (non-chain) food is not far away.

in particular, has fabulous destination dining, just across the Beltway at 2941 Restaurant (contemporary American, and easily some of the best in the D.C. area), as well as some of the best Vietnamese food outside
